version_description: Bug fixes and under-the-hood improvements to make your overall Qapital app experience better, stronger, and faster.
This release includes a few minor bug fixes and under-the-hood improvements to make your overall Qapital app experience better, stronger, and faster.
This release includes a few minor bug fixes and under-the-hood improvements to make your overall Qapital app experience better, stronger, and faster.

• You can now change your funding account from the “Your Accounts” view under the “Profile” tab.
• A few bug fixes and under-the-hood improvements to make your overall Qapital app experience better, stronger, and faster.

New! Weekly Insights are here! Curious about how you did last week? Now you’ll receive Weekly Insights and see your spending and saving highlights from the week. With Weekly Insights, you may discover ways to tweak your spending and saving to help achieve your goals faster. Or you may just give yourself a pat on the back for a job well done.

Bug fixes and under-the-hood improvements to make your overall Qapital app experience better, stronger, and faster.
Bug fixes and under-the-hood improvements to make your overall Qapital app experience better, stronger, and faster.

• Maps! See the location of transactions you make on your Qapital Visa® Debit Card. With the addition of street maps, you can now more easily verify and recall in-store purchases.
• Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.
Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.
The Weekly Spending Target now shows how much you’ve spent, not just what you have left. Set up your Weekly Spending Target today to easily stay on top of your spending!
Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.
Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.
Resolves a bug causing uploads of manual review documents to fail.
Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.
Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.
The Account Activity screen for investment goals has been updated. You’ll now see your deposits and withdrawals in the same list as your trades.
Resolves a bug where the app would crash for users with Apple Health rules

Investment Goals have a brand new look! Each Investment Goal now displays a chart of its performance, showing your earnings both as an amount and percentage. It also lists your total deposits, total withdrawals, total earnings, and rate of return.

The Weekly Spending Target has been updated. Now you can exclude part of a purchase from the Weekly Spending Target -- perfect when you put your card down at dinner for later payback from friends, make bulk purchases, or any other time you only want a portion of your purchase applied toward your Weekly Spending Target.

Support iOS 12 is here!
Automatic strong passwords - Automatically create a strong password for your Qapital account when you sign up. Your passwords will be stored in your iCloud Keychain.
Security code AutoFill - SMS one-time passcodes will appear automatically as AutoFill suggestions, so you never have to worry about quickly memorizing them or typing them again.
Password managers - You can now access your login credentials directly from the QuickType bar if you’re using a third-party password manager.
Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.

•Siri Shortcuts: Qapital now works even better with Siri! Siri learns from your behavior and will provide shortcuts from the lock screen, search, or Siri watch face so you can save money for your goals faster.

•Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.

We're releasing a whole new Qapital packed with smart money management tools:

Qapital Invest: Now you can invest with confidence with simple, pre-built investing portfolios matched to your Goals and investing style.

Payday Divvy: Divvy up your money as soon as a deposit hits. Cover your commitments and fund your Goals with just a few taps.

Spending Sweet Spot: This is the new name for the Weekly Spending Target – budget for your weekly expenses, grow more mindful of your spending, and use that knowledge as a future guide.

Money Missions: Try these fun challenges, designed to help you think a bit deeper about your spending. You’ll unlock helpful insights into how you use your money now, so you can use it better in the future.

A happy and prosperous New Year to all our members! As well as several bug fixes, our first update of 2019 includes a status visualisation for Spending Sweet Spot that gives you an instant overview of what you’ve spent.
Good news for Spending Sweet Spot users… now you can manually add cash transactions, giving you a truer picture of your spending. We've also fixed the bug that stopped people using Siri Shortcuts.
Hello face unlocking... Qapital now offers full support for Face ID on iOS. We’ve also fixed a number of bugs and made several performance enhancements under the hood.

A fresher, clearer look for Qapital

From today you'll start noticing a simpler, more navigable design in the app. Key features like transaction lists and the Goals page have been elegantly pared down to give users a quicker overview of their most important financial details.
Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.
Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.
Performance improvements and some bug fixes.
Bug fixes and other improvements to enhance your Qapital app experience.

Easier than ever to invest

We've jiggled things around a little in the app to make it easier for people to start investing - now you can create your first Invest Goal without even signing up for a Qapital Spending Account. We also fixed the bug that was stopping iOS 9 users from launching the app.

We've jiggled things around a little in the app to make it easier for people to start investing - now you can create your first Invest Goal without even signing up for a Qapital Spending Account. We also fixed the bug that was stopping iOS 9 users from launching the app.
Performance improvements and some bug fixes.

More power under the hood. We've tweaked and twanged a lot of things behind the scenes this week, the result of which is, you've guessed it, an improved performance. Also, if you've been busy referring your friends to Qapital, we've made it easier to see how much money you've earned.
Resolves an issue where sending a check would always fail.

A new look for Qapital

We’ve added several big features in the past year so it was time to take a step back and make sure our design foundations were still solid. The result is a loving refresh that puts more focus on your Goals thanks to a streamlined typography and a consolidated color palette. The more pared down look and feel is visible on all key screens now and will be rolled out across the rest of the app in weeks to come.

In amongst all the excitement we also found time to add Peek & Pop in the Wallet and Transactions screens.

A week of fine-tuning and fixing

After the excitement of releasing our updated design system last week, our focus switched to behind the scenes this week. Bugs were fixed, and performance was enhanced. Happy banking!

This week we've given our Apple Health integration some love, and implemented a simpler design for setting up your Rules. You'll also notice some improvements in your transaction details, including the ability to see when you've saved to an investment Goal, and which events triggered a batch transfer. The big news, though, is you can now sign in to Qapital with your Apple ID. Enjoy.

We want you to get the most out of your money, so we’ll now let you know when you create a Savings Goal that’s eligible for investing. Investment Goals are a great way to give your savings a little boost. We’ve also packed this release with bug fixes and general performance improvements.

In this version, we’ve updated the way we display your Goal information. Whether you have savings, investment or joint Goals, it’s now easier to see your Goal details and how much you’re saving. We’ve also fixed a few bugs, and done some maintenance work to keep things running nice and smoothly.

In this release we’ve focused on making sure that everything is running smoothly, so we’ve fixed a few bugs and performed some general app maintenance.

In this release, we’ve made a few functional updates and some visual changes. Our Goal suggestions have been redesigned, making it quick and easy to get a new Goal set up. We’ve also updated how things look when you’re editing one of your existing Goals. Plus, we’ve made some changes to Shared Goals! Try creating a Shared Goal to save with your friends and family.

No major changes this week, but rest assured we have plenty of upgrades to help you save, spend and invest better coming soon. This release contains some general maintenance work, and we’ve also fixed a few bugs and issues.

We’ve completed lots of important maintenance work this week in preparation for launching a few new features—look out for them in the coming months. We’ve also fixed a few bugs and other issues to keep everything running nicely.

Widget week

iOS 14 has everybody in a frenzy of homescreen sorting. We’ve jumped straight on the hype train by making it possible to add a Goal widget. We think it’s a nice way to keep your Goal top of mind. Happy sorting!

2FA is here

We’ve tightened up security by introducing two-factor authentication when logging in with your username and password. Now you’ll get a verification code via SMS that you enter when prompted.

We’ve also given Goals a pre-spring clean: the design of your completed Goals is now consistent with the look and feel of Goals across the app, and the Goal image on your Goals page is now more prominent.

Dream Team just got bigger

Good news for Dream Teamers who can now share balance and transactions from external linked accounts with one another. We have also made some improvements to your referrals list to give you a clearer overview of the status of each.

Spring cleaning in winter

We want to look our best when lockdown ends so lots of bug fixes and improvements this week – you know the drill.

Money moves made simpler

We’ve added a bunch of transfer shortcuts to your Move Money tab this week. If you’re using Dream Team, it will make it easier to transfer cash to your teammate. We’ve also added your own funding and spending accounts there so you can move your money around with less hassle.

What the Funkis?

The main update this week is the roll-out of a new, more readable typeface - Funkis. We went back to our Swedish roots with this one. Funkis was inspired by the characteristic number signs used on functionalist houses, as well as a famous poster used to promote the Stockholm Exhibition of 1930. We also fixed a bug or two.

What the Funkis?

The main update this week is the roll-out of a new, more readable typeface - Funkis. We went back to our Swedish roots with this one. Funkis was inspired by the characteristic number signs used on functionalist houses, as well as a famous poster used to promote the Stockholm Exhibition of 1930. We also fixed a bug or two.

Crashing out

Some of you reported an annoying crash bug this week - we found it and fixed it. We also mended a couple of other small holes in the fences.

Go looooong?

Transferring money to your Dream Team partner just got a little more fun. Why input digits when you can press and hold for the right amount?! Just make sure you’ve turned on Allow Deposits. We also fixed a few bugs and started prepping for something a bit bigger. More soon.
